snippet: The shutdown two years ago of lanes leading to the George Washington Bridge set off a chain of events that ultimately led to the surprise resignation of Jeff Smisek, the C.E.O. of United Airlines.
abstract: Lane closures at George Washington Bridge ordered by New Jersey Gov Chris Christie in 2013 set off chain of events that ultimately led to resignation of United Airlines chief executive Jeff Smisek; prosecutors, who are still trying to determine if crime was committed, are now looking into role played by Jamie Fox, longtime friend of former Port Authority chairman David Samson and onetime lobbyist for United, whom Christie appointed state transportation commissioner in 2014.

byline.original: By KATE ZERNIKE and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: The shutdown two years ago of lanes leading to the George Washington Bridge set off a chain of events that ultimately led to the surprise resignation of Jeff Smisek, the C.E.O. of United Airlines.

headline.main: Inquiry’s Trail: From George Washington Bridge to United’s Executive Offices
headline.print_headline: Inquiry’s Trail: From a Bridge to United’s Executive Offices

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
